alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 7:35PM MST until August 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Calva...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low-lying riparian areas flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MST Friday, August 26 the stage was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet around 12 noon Saturday. It will then slowly fall to 15.0 feet Saturday evening with the level continuing to slowly fall into Sunday. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 8 PM MST.
